title: "You can do that when you're an adult..." All I can do as an adult is bawl my eyes out over the childhood I never was allowed to have

author: walkingerection6318
text: You put my feelings into words. I want to make a good life for myself when I move out, but at the same time I don't want to give them the satisfaction. They'll say, "look at the successful kid I raised!" I'm gonna show them the type of kid they raised. It may be incredibly ignorant, but I need to prove to them that they were disgusting parents. Like that quote that says it takes a whole village to raise a child, but the child will burn the village down just to feel it's warmth, and I intend to do just that.

author: Wilted-Mushroom
text:
Please, I beg of you, do not throw your life away just to say "fuck you" to some assholes who don't care about you.

Succeed, go the distance, put your best foot forward every time. And when they try to pull the old "look at what a great job we done" publicly, and very loudly and proudly proclaim "if I had done what you taught, I'd be dead or in prison. This is MY achievement that I done on my own. You done nothing but prevent me from reaching my fullest potential so if I've succeeded even a little bit, it's because I taught myself how to even after you tried your darned hardest to set me up for failure"


You are worth more than you realise, don't let those smug pricks take away any satisfaction from your life, they've done enough of that.

Virtual hugs for you.

text: I'm with you, but question: how do you succeed if you have no life skills, and you always botch opportunities? Or worse, have no opportunities? Asking for...a friend... >\_>

author: OkayKatniss413
text: A lot of opportunities simply come if you're in the right place at the right time. Start putting yourself out there in the right places.

author: FlyingSagittarius
text: It depends on your current position and definition of success.  How old are you?  How are you living your life right now?  What do you have for education and work experience?  How well do you keep up with running a household?  Do you have friends? Hobbies?  Goals?  You might not be able to reach everyoneâ€™s definition of success, but you probably have something you can be proud of.

author: Zippy_G_1
text:
I'm in my low thirties, have a master's, many hobbies. Switching friends but on my way to making a few new ones. Never had a date. I'm still financially dependent on my n-family to a degree and that really bothers me that I have to say that at 30. (Though I'm almost free--and was very close until Covid hit me and now I am functionally disabled for the foreseeable future.)

I have goals but they seem pretty far away when they always come second to making just enough money to tread water (even with a master's). :| But, I suppose there is some good in there, at least.
